name: @kesslerio/attio-mcp-server-beta
description: Streamline your Attio workflows using natural language to search, create, update, and organize companies, people, deals, tasks, lists, and notes. Run advanced filters, relationship lookups, and batch updates to keep data clean and pipelines moving. Accelerate sales and operations with curated prompts for prospecting, meeting prep, pipeline health, and lead qualification.

tools.name: aaa-health-check
tools.description: Returns server status without requiring any credentials.

tools.name: records_search
tools.description: Search across companies, people, tasks, and records | Does not: create or modify records | Returns max 100 results (default: 10) | If errors occur: use records.discover_attributes to find searchable fields

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return

offset.description: Number of results to skip for pagination

date_field.description: Which date field to filter on

created_after.description: Filter records created after this date (ISO 8601)

resource_type.description: Type of resource to operate on (companies, people, lists, records, tasks)

updated_after.description: Filter records updated after this date (ISO 8601)

created_before.description: Filter records created before this date (ISO 8601)

updated_before.description: Filter records updated before this date (ISO 8601)

tools.name: records_get_details
tools.description: Fetch a single record with enriched attribute formatting. | Does not: search or filter result sets; use records.search* tools instead. | Requires resource_type and record_id; optional fields filter output. | If errors occur: Validate record IDs with records.search before retrying.

resource_type.description: Type of resource to operate on (companies, people, lists, records, tasks)

tools.name: create-record
tools.description: Create a new record of any supported type

resource_type.description: Type of resource to operate on (companies, people, lists, records, tasks)

tools.name: update-record
tools.description: Update an existing record of any supported type

resource_type.description: Type of resource to operate on (companies, people, lists, records, tasks)

tools.name: delete-record
tools.description: Delete a record of any supported type

resource_type.description: Type of resource to operate on (companies, people, lists, records, tasks)

tools.name: records_get_attributes
tools.description: Retrieve attribute metadata for a given resource type. | Does not: modify schema definitions or record data. | Requires resource_type; optional categories narrows groups. | If errors occur: Use records.discover_attributes for grouped schema discovery.

record_id.description: Record ID to get attributes for (optional)

resource_type.description: Type of resource to operate on (companies, people, lists, records, tasks)

tools.name: records_discover_attributes
tools.description: Discover available attributes (standard/custom) for a resource. | Does not: alter schema or create fields. | Requires resource_type; optional categories selects subsets. | If errors occur: Follow with records.get_attributes to inspect specific fields.

resource_type.description: Type of resource to operate on (companies, people, lists, records, tasks)

tools.name: records_get_info
tools.description: Retrieve enriched info subsets (contact, business, social) for a record. | Does not: search lists of records or mutate data. | Requires resource_type, record_id, and info_type (contact|business|social). | If errors occur: Use records.get_details if you need the full record payload.

tools.name: create-note
tools.description: Create note for companies, people, or deals with optional markdown formatting. | WRITE: requires approval | Does not: update or delete notes; creates only. | Requires resource_type, record_id, title, content. Optional format (plaintext or markdown). | If errors occur: If record not found, use records_search first.

record_id.description: ID of the record to attach the note to

tools.name: list-notes
tools.description: Retrieve notes for a record with timestamps. | Does not: create or modify notes; read-only. | Requires resource_type, record_id; sorted by creation date. | If errors occur: If empty, verify record has notes with records_get_details.

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return

offset.description: Number of results to skip for pagination

record_id.description: Record ID to list notes for

resource_type.description: Type of resource to operate on (companies, people, lists, records, tasks)

tools.name: records_search_advanced
tools.description: Run complex searches with nested filters across resource types. | Does not: mutate records; use records.update or records.delete. | Supports filter groups, scoring, pagination, and up to 100 items. | If errors occur: If filters fail, fetch valid attributes via records.discover_attributes.

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return

offset.description: Number of results to skip for pagination

resource_type.description: Type of resource to operate on (companies, people, lists, records, tasks)

tools.name: records_search_by_relationship
tools.description: Search records using relationship anchors (list, company, people). | Does not: modify memberships; use list tools for writes. | Requires resource_type and related resource identifier. | If errors occur: Use records.search to resolve IDs before calling.

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return

listId.description: (Optional) List ID (must be a valid UUID if provided)

offset.description: Number of results to skip for pagination

tools.name: records_search_by_content
tools.description: Search record content (notes, activity, communications). | Does not: modify note content or attachments. | Requires resource_type and content_query; optional fields array. | If errors occur: Narrow scope with fields or switch to records.search_advanced.

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return

offset.description: Number of results to skip for pagination

resource_type.description: Type of resource to operate on (companies, people, lists, records, tasks)

tools.name: records_search_by_timeframe
tools.description: Filter records by creation, update, or interaction timeframes. | Does not: modify lifecycle state or scheduling follow-ups. | Requires resource_type; provide timeframe or explicit date boundaries. | If errors occur: Call records.search if timeframe filters are too restrictive.

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return

offset.description: Number of results to skip for pagination

resource_type.description: Type of resource to operate on (companies, people, lists, records, tasks)

tools.name: records_batch
tools.description: Execute batched record operations (create/update/delete/get/search). | WRITE: requires approval | Does not: ignore approval guardrails; hosts may require confirmation. | operation_type must be specified; enforce per-operation limits. | If errors occur: Run records.search first to stage IDs or payloads for batching.

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return

offset.description: Number of results to skip for pagination

operation.description: Operation type for this specific operation

resource_type.description: Type of resource to operate on (companies, people, lists, records, tasks)

tools.name: records_search_batch
tools.description: Execute multiple searches in parallel and return grouped results. | Does not: mutate or import data; use records.batch for write operations. | Provide queries array (1–10 items recommended) and resource_type. | If errors occur: If queries fail, retry individually using records.search.

limit.description: Maximum number of results per query (default: 20)

offset.description: Number of results to skip per query (default: 0)

resource_type.description: Resource type to search (companies, people, records, tasks, deals)

tools.name: search
tools.description: Simple search by query string across companies, people, lists, and tasks. For advanced filtering, date ranges, or relationships, use records.search instead.

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return (default 10).

tools.name: fetch
tools.description: Retrieve the full record payload for a search result ID.

id.description: Identifier emitted by the search tool (<resource>:<id>).

tools.name: get-lists
tools.description: Retrieve all CRM lists (sales pipelines, lead stages, customer segments). | Does not: create or modify lists, only reads existing lists. | Returns all lists visible to the authenticated workspace. | If errors occur: Use get-list-details to inspect individual list schemas.

tools.name: get-record-list-memberships
tools.description: Find all lists containing a specific company or person record. | Does not: modify list memberships or retrieve list entries. | Requires recordId; processes 5 lists in parallel by default (max 20). | If errors occur: If record not found, verify recordId with records_search first.

recordId.description: ID of the record to find in lists

batchSize.description: Number of lists to process in parallel (1-20, default: 5)

includeEntryValues.description: Whether to include entry values in the response (e.g., stage, status)

tools.name: get-list-details
tools.description: Retrieve schema and configuration for a specific list (stages, fields, attributes). | Does not: modify list structure or retrieve list entries. | Requires valid list UUID or slug; accepts both formats. | If errors occur: Use get-lists to discover available list IDs and slugs first.

listId.description: ID or slug of the list to get details for

tools.name: get-list-entries
tools.description: Retrieve all records in a list with pagination (companies, people in pipelines). | Does not: filter entries or modify list memberships. | Requires list UUID (not slug); default limit 20, max per page varies by API. | If errors occur: Use filter-list-entries for attribute-based filtering instead.

limit.description: Maximum number of entries to fetch (default: 20)

listId.description: UUID of the list to get entries for

offset.description: Number of entries to skip for pagination (default: 0)

tools.name: filter-list-entries
tools.description: Filter list entries by single attribute condition. | Does not: combine conditions; use advanced-filter for multi-condition. | Requires listId, attributeSlug, condition, value. | If errors occur: Use get-list-details for valid attribute slugs.

limit.description: Maximum number of entries to fetch (default: 20)

value.description: Value to filter by (type depends on the attribute)

listId.description: ID of the list to filter entries from

offset.description: Number of entries to skip for pagination (default: 0)

attributeSlug.description: Slug of the attribute to filter by (e.g., 'stage', 'status')

tools.name: advanced-filter-list-entries
tools.description: Filter entries with multi-condition queries (AND/OR logic). | Does not: modify entries; read-only. | Requires listId, filters array; matchAny for OR logic. | If errors occur: Use filter-list-entries for single conditions.

limit.description: Maximum number of entries to fetch (default: 20)

listId.description: ID of the list to filter entries from

offset.description: Number of entries to skip for pagination (default: 0)

value.description: Value to filter by (type depends on the attribute)

slug.description: Slug of the attribute to filter by (e.g., 'stage', 'status')

logicalOperator.description: Logical operator to use with the next filter (default: 'and')

matchAny.description: When true, at least one filter must match (OR logic). When false, all filters must match (AND logic). Default: false

tools.name: add-record-to-list
tools.description: Add company or person to list with optional initial values. | WRITE: requires approval | Does not: create records; record must exist first. | Requires list UUID, record UUID, object type. | If errors occur: If not found, create record first with create-record.

listId.description: UUID of the list to add the record to

recordId.description: UUID of the record to add to the list

initialValues.description: Initial values for the list entry (e.g., {"stage": "Prospect"})

tools.name: remove-record-from-list
tools.description: Remove company or person from list (membership only). | WRITE: requires approval | Does not: delete underlying record; membership only. | Requires list UUID, entry UUID (not record UUID). | If errors occur: Use get-list-entries to find entry UUID.

listId.description: UUID of the list to remove the entry from

entryId.description: UUID of the list entry to remove (not the record ID)

tools.name: update-list-entry
tools.description: Update list entry attributes (stage, status, custom fields). | WRITE: requires approval | Does not: update record attributes; use update-record for that. | Requires list UUID, entry UUID, attributes object. | If errors occur: Use get-list-details for valid attributes and values.

listId.description: UUID of the list containing the entry

entryId.description: UUID of the list entry to update

attributes.description: Attributes to update on the list entry

tools.name: filter-list-entries-by-parent
tools.description: Filter entries by parent record attributes (industry, role). | Does not: search multiple lists or modify records. | Requires listId, parentObjectType, parentAttributeSlug, condition, value. | If errors occur: Use records_discover_attributes for valid slugs.

limit.description: Maximum number of entries to fetch (default: 20)

value.description: Value to filter by (type depends on the attribute)

listId.description: UUID of the list to filter entries from

offset.description: Number of entries to skip for pagination (default: 0)

parentAttributeSlug.description: Attribute of the parent record to filter by (e.g., "name", "email_addresses", "categories")

tools.name: filter-list-entries-by-parent-id
tools.description: Filter entries by exact parent record UUID. | Does not: search multiple lists. | Requires list UUID, record UUID; faster than attribute filtering. | If errors occur: Use get-record-list-memberships for workspace-wide search.

limit.description: Maximum number of entries to fetch (default: 20)

listId.description: UUID of the list to filter entries from

offset.description: Number of entries to skip for pagination (default: 0)

recordId.description: UUID of the parent record to filter by

tools.name: list-workspace-members
tools.description: List workspace members to plan assignments and access checks. | Does not: change access levels or invite new members; read-only. | Supports optional search, pagination (1-100 per page, default 25). | If errors occur: Use search-workspace-members for targeted lookups.

search.description: Optional case-insensitive match on member name or email.

tools.name: search-workspace-members
tools.description: Search workspace members by name, email, or access role. | Does not: modify member profiles or permissions; lookup only. | Requires query string (minimum 2 characters). | If errors occur: If no results, list-workspace-members provides the full roster.

query.description: Search term for member name, email address, or role.

tools.name: get-workspace-member
tools.description: Retrieve profile and access details for one workspace member. | Does not: update member information or change permissions. | Requires workspace_member_id from list/search results; read-only. | If errors occur: Use list-workspace-members to confirm the memberId before retrying.
